page.shortlink: Lock unlock a container DIV or entire page by showing an overlay over it
page.topic: Lock/unlock a container, DIV or entire page (by showing an overlay over it)
page.description: Lock a container, DIV or entire page by showing an overlay over it so that the user can't click on the controls under the overlay, or unlock the element.

section.description: Used with the Grid and UX components.

item.name: Lock/Unlock type
item.description: Specify if you want to lock/unlock the entire page, or just an element (Container or arbitrary DIV). Choices include *[ui:Page]*, *[ui:Element]*.

item.name: Mode
item.description: Specify if you want to lock an element, or unlock a previously locked element. Choices include *[ui:Lock]*, *[ui:Unlock]*.

item.name: Automatically unlock after duration
item.description: Specify if the element should be automatically unlocked after a specified number of milliseconds. Enter 0 to never automatically unlock the element. For example, enter 1000 to automatically unlock after 1 second.

item.name: Lock class
item.description: Specify the CSS class for the overlay that is used to lock the specified object.

item.name: Object type
item.description: Specify if the object you want to lock/unlock or is a Container control, or an arbitrary DIV. Choices include *[ui:Container]*, *[ui:DIV]*.

item.name: DIV ID
item.description: Specify the ID of the DIV.

item.name: Container ID
item.description: Specify the ID of the container. Choices include.

videos.title: Using Action Javascript to Lock the Page or a Portion of the Page During an Ajax Callback

description.p: A common requirement in Ajax applications is to 'lock' the screen, or a portion of the screen, for the duration of the callback. This prevents the user from performing some action that is not appropriate during a callback. A transparent overlay is displayed over the screen or element to 'lock' it.
In this video we show how you can use Action Javascript to lock either the entire screen, or a portion of the screen.
This technique can be used in both the Grid and UX Component.
